original: @214a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @214a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya si t'a ta pa tre aa pa r'a dzi ta s'a dha nam /
analyzed: a'arya si t'a ta pa tre aa pa r'a dzi ta s'a dha nam /
translated: Aryasitapaatre Aparajitasadhanam

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags ma gdugs dkar mo can gzhan gyis mi thub pa sgrub pa'i thabs /
analyzed: 'phags ma gdugs dkar mo can gzhan gyis mi thub pa sgrub pa'i thabs /
translated: The Means of Attaining the White Parasol, Aparajita

original: gsang ba'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Lord of Secrets, Vajrapani.

original: dang por tho rangs langs te /
analyzed: dang por tho rangs langs te /
translated: First, upon rising at dawn,

original: byang chub kyi sems dran par byas la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dran par byas la /
translated: recall the thought of awakening.

original: rang tha mal pa'i snying ga phye ba'i steng du zla ba nya ba la aom dkar po bsams te /
analyzed: rang tha mal pa'i snying ga phye ba'i steng du zla ba nya ba la aom dkar po bsams te /
translated: Visualize a white om on a full moon above your open heart.

original: de'i 'od kyis rang gi sdig pa dag pa dang / kha dang ba spu'i bu ga nas 'thon te /
analyzed: de'i 'od kyis rang gi sdig pa dag pa dang / kha dang ba spu'i bu ga nas 'thon te /
translated: Its light purifies your misdeeds, and they emerge from your mouth and pores.

original: sems can gyi don byas shing /
analyzed: sems can gyi don byas shing /
translated: Having benefited sentient beings,

original: 'og min nas gdugs dkar mo can /
analyzed: 'og min nas gdugs dkar mo can /
translated: invite the White Parasol from Akanishtha

original: bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' bskor ba mdun gyi nam mkha' la spyan drangs te /
analyzed: bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' bskor ba mdun gyi nam mkha' la spyan drangs te /
translated: surrounded by gurus, buddhas, and bodhisattvas into the space in front.

original: phyag 'tshal ba dang mchod pa dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / skyabs su 'gro ba dang / lam bsten pa dang / sems bskyed de /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba dang mchod pa dang / sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang / skyabs su 'gro ba dang / lam bsten pa dang / sems bskyed de /
translated: One should perform the five limbs of worship,🔽which are prostration, offering, confession of sins, rejoicing in merit, going for refuge,

original: yan lag lnga pa byas la /
analyzed: yan lag lnga pa byas la /
translated: and arousing the mind of enlightenment.

original: de'i bsod nams byang chub tu bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bsod nams byang chub tu bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: One should dedicate the merit of that to enlightenment.

original: de nas byams snying rje dga' ba btang snyoms bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas byams snying rje dga' ba btang snyoms bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then one should cultivate loving kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: de nas snod bcud ma lus pa bsdus te /
analyzed: de nas snod bcud ma lus pa bsdus te /
translated: Then one should gather the entire world and its inhabitants

original: stong pa nyid dmigs la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dmigs la /
translated: and visualize emptiness.

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma konyham zhes brjod do //
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma konyham zhes brjod do //
translated: One should recite, “Oṃ śūnyatā-jñāna-vajra-svabhāvātmako ’haṃ.”

original: de'i rjes su pam las padma'i steng du aa las zla ba'i @214b dkyil 'khor dmigs la /🔽de'i steng du aom dkar po dang bcas par gyur pa las /
analyzed: de'i rjes su pam las padma'i steng du aa las zla ba'i @214b dkyil 'khor dmigs la / de'i steng du aom dkar po dang bcas par gyur pa las /
translated: After that, one should visualize a lotus from paṃ and a moon maṇḍala from a in its center.

original: gdugs dkar mo can gyi sku bsam ste /
analyzed: gdugs dkar mo can gyi sku bsam ste /
translated: Upon that, one should visualize a white oṃ,🔽which becomes the form of Sitātapatrā.

original: zhal gsum pa la phyag drug ma //
analyzed: zhal gsum pa la phyag drug ma //
translated: She has three faces and six arms.

original: sku mdog dkar mo 'gying bag can //
analyzed: sku mdog dkar mo 'gying bag can //
translated: Her body is white and she is graceful.

original: dbus dkar g-yas sngo g-yon dmar zhal //
analyzed: dbus dkar g-yas sngo g-yon dmar zhal //
translated: The middle face is white, the right blue, and the left red.

original: spyan gsum khro mo'i lta stangs can ;🔽/ g-yas pa 'khor lo lcags kyu mda' //
analyzed: spyan gsum khro mo'i lta stangs can ; / g-yas pa 'khor lo lcags kyu mda' //
translated: She has three eyes and a wrathful gaze.🔽Her right hands hold a chakram, iron hook, and arrow,

original: g-yon pa rdo rje dkar po gzhu //
analyzed: g-yon pa rdo rje dkar po gzhu //
translated: and her left hands hold a white vajra, bow,

original: zhags pa dang bcas sdigs mdzub nyid //
analyzed: zhags pa dang bcas sdigs mdzub nyid //
translated: and a threatening gesture with a noose.

original: gza' kun 'joms par byed pa ma //
analyzed: gza' kun 'joms par byed pa ma //
translated: She is the one who destroys all the planets.

original: skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyis bzhugs //
analyzed: skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyis bzhugs //
translated: She stands in half-dance posture.

original: lha yi rgyan dang na bza' ldan //
analyzed: lha yi rgyan dang na bza' ldan //
translated: She is adorned with divine ornaments and garments.

original: rnam snang mdzad kyis dbu brgyan ma//
analyzed: rnam snang mdzad kyis dbu brgyan ma//
translated: Vairocana is her head ornament.

original: de ltar bdag nyid lha mor bsam //
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid lha mor bsam //
translated: Visualize yourself in that way as the goddess.

original: de'i snying gang padma'i steng zla ba la aom dkar po'i 'od zer gyis /
analyzed: de'i snying gang padma'i steng zla ba la aom dkar po'i 'od zer gyis /
translated: In her heart, on a lotus and moon, is a white oṃ,🔽the light rays of which invoke the awareness beings, who are dissolved into it.

original: ye shes sems dpa' spyan drangs la gzhug pa dang / dbang bskur zhing rigs kyi dbu rgyan gyi bdag po rnam snang gis rgyas gdab ste /
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' spyan drangs la gzhug pa dang / dbang bskur zhing rigs kyi dbu rgyan gyi bdag po rnam snang gis rgyas gdab ste /
translated: The empowerment is conferred, and the master of the family, Vairocana, seals it.

original: yi ge gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs la phyag rgya bcas te /
analyzed: yi ge gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs la phyag rgya bcas te /
translated: Bless it with the three syllables and form the mudra.

original: lag pa khu tshur snying gar bca' ste /
analyzed: lag pa khu tshur snying gar bca' ste /
translated: Make a fist with the left hand and place it at the heart.

original: lag pa g-yon pa'i khu tshur g-yas pa'i mdzub mo nas gyen du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa'i khu tshur g-yas pa'i mdzub mo nas gyen du blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should hold up the left hand in a fist, with the right index finger pointing upward.

original: sngags bzlas pa ni /
analyzed: sngags bzlas pa ni /
translated: The mantra recitation is:🔽Oṃ sitātapatrāparājitā sarva-grāha-trāyai yāyai yā

original: aom si t'a ta pa tre aa pa r'a dzi ta sarba gra h'a na tra y'a y'a ya y'a ha na dr'um dr'um hram hram phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom si t'a ta pa tre aa pa r'a dzi ta sarba gra h'a na tra y'a y'a ya y'a ha na dr'um dr'um hram hram phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: hāna dhrūṃ dhrūṃ hram hram phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: snying po'o // gtor ma ni yi ge gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: snying po'o // gtor ma ni yi ge gsum gyis byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: The essence mantra. Having consecrated the bali offering with the three syllables,

original: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a n'am a'adya nutpan na tv'a ta aom a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a n'am a'adya nutpan na tv'a ta aom a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā,

original: zhes 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor mas sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor mas sbyin par bya'o //
translated: one should offer it with the bali offering for all the bhūtas.

original: 'phags pa gdugs dkar mo can gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'phags pa gdugs dkar mo can gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana of the noble Sitātapatrā Aparājitā is complete.

original: // / rgya gar shar phyogs kyi pandi ta bi bh'u ti tsandra dang / glo bo lo ts'a ba dge slong shes rab rin chen gyis bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: // / rgya gar shar phyogs kyi pandi ta bi bh'u ti tsandra dang / glo bo lo ts'a ba dge slong shes rab rin chen gyis bsgyur ba'o//
translated: Translated by the Indian paṇḍita Vibhūticandra and the Tibetan translator-monk Sherab Rinchen from the eastern region.
